languages.text: Рождение и смерть суть одно. Мы приходим в незнакомый мир окровавленные и вырванные из тепла — таково же умирание. Это познал{mf||а} и Домин, открыв глаза в хладном гробу на нижних палубах. Узрел{mf||а} {mf|он|она} свой корабль, плывущий в небытии — адамантиумный труп гиганта, скелет, стенающий от ветров энтропии. Ржавая буря глодала пласталевые кости и трепала вены проводов, а по переборкам текла сукровица машинного масла. В этой искореженной утробе Домин заплутал{mf||а} бы в одиночестве, но проводник протянул {mf|ему|ей} руку.

Birth and Death are one. We are snatched from a place of warmth and sent blood-covered into an unfamiliar world: dying is the same. The Domin, too, learned this as {mf|he|she} opened {mf|his|her} eyes and found {mf|himself|herself} on the lower decks, lying in a cold coffin. {mf|He|She} beheld {mf|his|her} ship, drifting through nothingness: an adamantine giant's corpse, a skeleton moaning from the winds of entropy. A tempest of rust was gnawing at its plasteel bones and twisting its vein-like cables, while machine oil oozed down its bulkheads like lymph. Had the Domin been alone, {mf|he|she} would have lost {mf|his|her} way inside the ship's mangled bowels, but a guide reached out a hand to {mf|him|her}.
languages.original_text: Рождение и смерть суть одно. Мы приходим в незнакомый мир окровавленные и вырванные из тепла — таково же умирание. Это познал{mf||а} и Домин, открыв глаза в хладном гробу на нижних палубах. Узрел{mf||а} {mf|он|она} свой корабль, плывущий в небытии — адамантиумный труп гиганта, скелет, стенающий от ветров энтропии. Ржавая буря глодала пласталевые кости и трепала вены проводов, а по переборкам текла сукровица машинного масла. В этой искореженной утробе Домин заплутал{mf||а} бы в одиночестве, но проводник протянул {mf|ему|ей} руку.

traits.locale_text: Birth and death are one. We are snatched from a place of warmth and sent blood-covered into an unfamiliar world: dying is the same. The Enim learned this too as {mf|he|she} opened {mf|his|her} eyes and found {mf|himself|herself} in the lower decks, lying in a cold coffin. {mf|He|She} beheld {mf|his|her} ship, drifting through nothingness: an adamantine giant's corpse, a skeleton moaning from the winds of entropy. A tempest of rust was gnawing at its plasteel bones and twisting its vein-like cables, while machine oil oozed like lymph down its bulkheads. Had the Enim been alone, {mf|he|she} have lost {mf|his|her} way inside the ship's mangled belly, but a guide reached out a hand to {mf|him|her}.

languages.text: Geburt und Tod sind eins. Wir werden aus einem Ort der Wärme gerissen und blutbedeckt in eine uns unbekannte Welt geschickt. Sterben ist nicht anders. Auch {mf|der|die} Domin lernte dies, als {mf|er|sie} die Augen öffnete und sich in einem kalten Sarg auf den Unterdecks wiederfand. {mf|Er|Sie} sah {mf|sein|ihr} Schiff, durchs Nichts treibend: der Leichnam eines Adamantriesen, ein Skelett, das von den Winden der Entropie gepeitscht laut stöhnte. Ein Sturm aus Rost nagte an seinen Knochen aus Plaststahl und verdrehte seine adernartigen Kabel, während Maschinenöl seine Schotten herunterrann wie Lymphe. Wäre {mf|der|die} Domin allein gewesen, hätte {mf|er|sie} sich in den zerfleischten Eingeweiden des Schiffs verirrt, doch ein Führer reichte {mf|ihm|ihr} eine helfende Hand.
languages.original_text: Birth and Death are one. We are snatched from a place of warmth and sent blood-covered into an unfamiliar world: dying is the same. The Domin, too, learned this as {mf|he|she} opened {mf|his|her} eyes and found {mf|himself|herself} on the lower decks, lying in a cold coffin. {mf|He|She} beheld {mf|his|her} ship, drifting through nothingness: an adamantine giant's corpse, a skeleton moaning from the winds of entropy. A tempest of rust was gnawing at its plasteel bones and twisting its vein-like cables, while machine oil oozed down its bulkheads like lymph. Had the Domin been alone, {mf|he|she} would have lost {mf|his|her} way inside the ship's mangled bowels, but a guide reached out a hand to {mf|him|her}.

Auch {mf|der|die} Domin lernte dies, als {mf|er|sie} die Augen öffnete und sich in einem kalten Sarg auf den Unterdecks wiederfand. {mf|Er|Sie} sah {mf|sein|ihr} Schiff, durchs Nichts treibend: der Leichnam eines Adamantriesen, ein Skelett, das von den Winden der Entropie gepeitscht laut stöhnte. Wäre {mf|der|die} Domin allein gewesen, hätte {mf|er|sie} sich in den zerfleischten Eingeweiden des Schiffs verirrt, doch ein Führer reichte {mf|ihm|ihr} eine helfende Hand.

languages.text: Nacer y morir son uno. Nos arrancan de un lugar cálido y nos envían, cubiertos de sangre, a un mundo desconocido. Lo mismo pasa al morir. {mf|El|La} Domin también lo descubrió al abrir sus ojos y ver que estaba en un frío ataúd en las cubiertas inferiores. Contempló su nave a la deriva en el vacío: un cadáver adamantino, un esqueleto mecido por los vientos de la entropía. Una vorágine de óxido roía sus huesos de plastiacero, retorciendo cables como si fueran venas, y de las mamparas manaba aceite para máquinas como si fuera linfa. De haber estado sol{mf|o|a}, {mf|el|la} Domin se habría extraviado entre las entrañas mutiladas de la nave, pero una mano amiga le ayudó a orientarse.
languages.original_text: Birth and Death are one. We are snatched from a place of warmth and sent blood-covered into an unfamiliar world: dying is the same. The Domin, too, learned this as {mf|he|she} opened {mf|his|her} eyes and found {mf|himself|herself} on the lower decks, lying in a cold coffin. {mf|He|She} beheld {mf|his|her} ship, drifting through nothingness: an adamantine giant's corpse, a skeleton moaning from the winds of entropy. A tempest of rust was gnawing at its plasteel bones and twisting its vein-like cables, while machine oil oozed down its bulkheads like lymph. Had the Domin been alone, {mf|he|she} would have lost {mf|his|her} way inside the ship's mangled bowels, but a guide reached out a hand to {mf|him|her}.

Una vorágine de óxido roía sus huesos de plastiacero, retorciendo cables como si fueran venas, y de las mamparas manaba aceite para máquinas como si fuera linfa. De haber estado sol{mf|o|a}, {mf|el|la} Domin se habría extraviado entre las entrañas mutiladas de la nave, pero una mano amiga le ayudó a orientarse.

languages.text: 誕生と死は一体である。我らは、あたたかな場所から血に塗れて見知らぬ世界へと放り出される。死も同じこと。ドミンもまた、その目を開き、下層デッキで冷たい棺に横たわることでそれを知った。{mf|彼|彼女}はヴォイドを漂う自身の船を見た。アダマンチウムの巨人の死体、エントロピーの風に呻く骸骨。錆の嵐がプラスチールの骨をかじり、血管のようなケーブルをねじる。その間、機械油が隔壁からリンパ液のようににじみ出ていた。ドミンが一人であれば、{mf|彼|彼女}は船のズタボロになった腹の中で彷徨っていただろう。けれど導き手が{mf|彼|彼女}へと手を差し伸べた。
languages.original_text: Birth and Death are one. We are snatched from a place of warmth and sent blood-covered into an unfamiliar world: dying is the same. The Domin, too, learned this as {mf|he|she} opened {mf|his|her} eyes and found {mf|himself|herself} on the lower decks, lying in a cold coffin. {mf|He|She} beheld {mf|his|her} ship, drifting through nothingness: an adamantine giant's corpse, a skeleton moaning from the winds of entropy. A tempest of rust was gnawing at its plasteel bones and twisting its vein-like cables, while machine oil oozed down its bulkheads like lymph. Had the Domin been alone, {mf|he|she} would have lost {mf|his|her} way inside the ship's mangled bowels, but a guide reached out a hand to {mf|him|her}.

traits.locale_text: 誕生と死は一体である。我らは、あたたかな場所から血に塗れて見知らぬ世界へと放り出される。死も同じこと。エニムもまた、その目を開き、下層デッキで冷たい棺に横たわることでそれを知った。{mf|彼|彼女}はヴォイドを漂う自身の船を見た。アダマンチウムの巨人の死体、エントロピーの風に呻く骸骨。錆の嵐がプラスチールの骨をかじり、血管のようなケーブルをねじる。その間、機械油が隔壁からリンパ液のようににじみ出ていた。エニムが一人であれば、{mf|彼|彼女}は船のズタボロになった腹の中で彷徨っていただろう。けれど導き手が{mf|彼|彼女}へと手を差し伸べた。

languages.text: 生与死本为一体。我们从温暖的地方被人带走，浑身是血，来到了全然陌生的世界之中，而死亡也同样如此。当秘者睁开双眼，发现自己躺在底层甲板冰冷的棺材里时，{mf|他|她}意识到了生与死的真理。{mf|他|她}看到{mf|他|她}的虚空舰在虚无之中飘荡，宛如精金巨人的尸体一般，巨人的骸骨在熵的风暴中呻吟。铁锈构成的风暴啃噬着塑钢制成的骨骼，扭曲着如同血脉的钢缆，机油仿佛淋巴液一样，从舱壁中不断渗出。如果秘者当时孤身一人，那{mf|他|她}注定会在舰船扭曲的肚肠之中迷失方向，但{mf|他|她}的向导及时赶到。
languages.original_text: Birth and Death are one. We are snatched from a place of warmth and sent blood-covered into an unfamiliar world: dying is the same. The Domin, too, learned this as {mf|he|she} opened {mf|his|her} eyes and found {mf|himself|herself} on the lower decks, lying in a cold coffin. {mf|He|She} beheld {mf|his|her} ship, drifting through nothingness: an adamantine giant's corpse, a skeleton moaning from the winds of entropy. A tempest of rust was gnawing at its plasteel bones and twisting its vein-like cables, while machine oil oozed down its bulkheads like lymph. Had the Domin been alone, {mf|he|she} would have lost {mf|his|her} way inside the ship's mangled bowels, but a guide reached out a hand to {mf|him|her}.

traits.locale_text: 生与死本为一体。我们从温暖的地方被人带走，浑身是血，来到了全然陌生的世界之中，而死亡也同样如此。当秘者睁开双眼，发现自己躺在底层甲板冰冷的棺材里时，{mf|他|她}意识到了生与死的真理。{mf|他|她}看到{mf|他|她}的虚空舰在虚无之中飘荡，宛如精金巨人的尸体一般，巨人的骸骨在熵的风暴中呻吟。铁锈构成的风暴啃噬着塑钢制成的骨骼，扭曲着如同血脉的钢缆，机油仿佛淋巴液一样，从舱壁中不断渗出。如果秘者当时孤身一人，那{mf|他|她}注定会在舰船扭曲的肚肠之中迷失方向，但{mf|他|她}的向导及时赶到。

languages.text: La naissance et la mort ne font qu'un. Nous sommes arrachés à la chaleur et à la sécurité, puis projetés couverts de sang dans un monde inconnu, dans la vie comme dans la mort. {mf|Le|La} Domin l'apprit également en ouvrant les yeux sur les ponts inférieurs, {mf|couché|couchée} dans un cercueil glacial. {mf|Il|Elle} contempla son vaisseau dérivant dans le néant : un gigantesque cadavre d'adamantine, un squelette gémissant balayé par les vents de l'entropie, une carcasse de plastacier et de câbles ravagée par une tempête de rouille et suintant d'huile de machine. Si {mf|le|la} Domin avait été {mf|seul|seule}, {mf|il|elle} se serait {mf|perdu|perdue} dans les entrailles putrides du vaisseau, mais un guide lui tendit la main.

The Domin, too, learned this as {mf|he|she} opened {mf|his|her} eyes and found {mf|himself|herself} on the lower decks, lying in a cold coffin. {mf|He|She} beheld {mf|his|her} ship, drifting through nothingness: an adamantine giant's corpse, a skeleton moaning from the winds of entropy. A tempest of rust was gnawing at its plasteel bones and twisting its vein-like cables, while machine oil oozed down its bulkheads like lymph. Had the Domin been alone, {mf|he|she} would have lost {mf|his|her} way inside the ship's mangled bowels, but a guide reached out a hand to {mf|him|her}.

languages.text: Doğum ve Ölüm birdir. Sıcacık bir yerden alınıp kanlar içinde aşina olmadığımız bir dünyaya gönderiliriz. Ölmek de buna benzer. Domin de bunu gözlerini açtığında kendini alt güvertelerdeki buz gibi bir tabutun içinde bulunca öğrendi. Hiçlik boyunca sürüklenip duran gemisini seyretti. O gemi ki adamantinden yapılma devasa bir ceset, entropi rüzgarlarıyla inleyen bir iskeletti. Plasçelik kemiklerini içten içe kemirip damar misali kablolarını eğip büken bir pas kasırgasıydı. Lenf bezi misali bölme panellerinden makine yağı sızardı. Domin yalnız olsaydı geminin ezilmiş iç kısımlarında muhakkak ki yolunu kaybederdi. Ancak bir kılavuz, ona yardım elini uzattı.
languages.original_text: Birth and Death are one. We are snatched from a place of warmth and sent blood-covered into an unfamiliar world: dying is the same.
